state_analysis: The test script creation continues to fail due to improperly formatted escape characters in the echo command. This leads to syntax errors when the script is run. The repeated attempts to run the script lead to the same errors.
explanation: I will recreate the test script without using escape characters that cause issues. I will ensure that the script is created properly, formatted correctly, and can run without syntax errors. After creating the script successfully, I will run it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo "import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print('Test passed!')" > test_script.py
